body.p: Oxygen levels drastically affect the severity of sickle cell anemia. Low oxygen conditions, such as at high altitudes, promotes red blood cell sickling in individuals with the mutation sickle cell disease.

Incorrect. This is something that changes or is affected. It is not a length scale.

Correct. The oxygen (O2) is the chemical that changes. The nitrogenous base in the DNA is not impacted in the presence of oxygen, the mutation is always present but the disease is exacerbated by the oxygen levels.
Incorrect. This is something that changes or is affected. It is not a length scale.
Incorrect. Oxygen is an element.

Correct. The structure of the b-globin changes. The mutated protein has the same sequence in high and low oxygen cases, but the structure is altered by the complexation with oxygen.
